items.title: Google lifts ban on AI weapons, surveillance in guidelines
items.summary:
- On Feb. 5, Google updated its AI Principles, removing the commitment to avoid harmful AI applications, including weapons and surveillance.
- The updated guidelines focus on evaluating AI projects based on risk-benefit analysis and alignment with international law and human rights.
- Previously, Google pledged to avoid technologies that could cause harm or violate norms, which is no longer stated in their principles.

items.title: BlackRock to hire 1,200 people in India for AI growth
items.summary:
- BlackRock plans to hire about 1,200 employees in India to enhance operations, focusing on AI capabilities.
- Recruitment will expand support hubs, known as iHubs, in Mumbai and Gurugram, increasing workforce from 3,500.
- BlackRock aims to acquire a global capabilities center in Bangalore as part of the proposed purchase of data firm Preqin.
- The firm is specifically looking to recruit engineers and data experts for growing AI projects, with specific hiring plans not yet finalized.
- To accommodate the new hires, BlackRock has secured additional office space in Goregaon, Mumbai, with a lease valued at nearly 4 billion rupees (approximately US$45.9 million).

items.title: Sam Altman to visit Abu Dhabi for MGX funding: sources
items.summary:
- Sam Altman is set to visit Abu Dhabi for MGX funding discussions.
- The trip signifies potential investments in the region by Altman's initiatives.
- This marks a continuation of his engagement with Middle Eastern markets.

items.title: Uber opens waitlist for Waymo driverless rides in Austin
items.summary:
- Uber has launched a waitlist for driverless rides with Waymo in Austin.
- The service will begin later this year and users can join the waitlist starting February 5 via the Uber app.
- The initial coverage area is 37 square miles, including Hyde Park and downtown, with expansion plans in the future.

items.title: UAE-based fintech Yuze expands to India
items.summary:
- Yuze, a fintech firm from the UAE, plans to expand to India in Q2 2025.
- The company will provide digital business banking services for micro and small enterprises and freelancers.
- Services include digital business accounts, automated invoicing, expense tracking, and digital onboarding.
- Yuze aims to address challenges Indian SMEs face with accessing financial services.
- Currently, Yuze operates in the UAE and is also preparing to launch in Saudi Arabia.
- As part of its India entry, Yuze is adapting its platform for local regulations and hiring key roles.

items.title: Payroll firm Workday to cut 1,750 workers
items.summary:
- Workday Inc. plans to reduce its workforce by 1,750 employees, representing 8.5% of its total staff.
- The layoffs are due to increased competition and a challenging spending environment.
- The company expects layoff-related costs to be between US$230 million and $270 million, including US$60 million to US$70 million in the fiscal fourth quarter.

items.title: Apple stock drops amid potential Chinese App Store probe
items.summary:
- Apple’s stock fell about 1% on Feb. 5 after reports of a potential investigation by Chinese regulators into its App Store practices.
- The State Administration for Market Regulation (SAMR) is reviewing Apple’s 30% fee on in-app purchases and limitations on third-party payment options.
- A decision on whether to initiate a formal probe has not yet been made.
- This investigation comes amid ongoing US-China trade tensions, with Apple facing scrutiny over its App Store policies in various regions, including actions taken by the European Union.
- Such a probe could increase challenges for Apple in China, a critical market where it faces declining sales and competition from local firms like Huawei.

items.title: Qatari sovereign fund kicks off $1b fund program
items.summary:
- Rasmal Ventures LLC announced funding from Qatar Investment Authority (QIA).
- The funding supports Rasmal’s inaugural fund, Rasmal Innovation Fund I LLC, part of QIA’s $1 billion Fund of Funds program.
- The fund program, opened to applicants in February 2024, aims to promote economic development and address funding gaps for regional entrepreneurs.
- Rasmal Innovation Fund I is managed by a team with extensive VC experience, aiming for $100 million in investment commitments.

items.title: EFishery faces restructuring after fraud allegations
Indian cybersecurity firm raises $2.7m, targets US market
items.author: Shikhil Sharma, Ananda Krishna
items.summary:
- Astra Security, a Bengaluru-based cybersecurity startup, raised $2.7 million in a funding round led by Emergent Ventures.
- Funds will enhance product offerings and support expansion into the US market and AI-driven technology development.
- Founded in 2018, Astra specializes in pentesting solutions to identify cybersecurity vulnerabilities for organizations.
- The platform tests web applications, APIs, and network security using AI to simulate cyberattacks.
- Plans to invest in AI-driven security detection tools and expand into cloud security next year.
- Currently, 45% of clients are based in the US, with notable Indian clients including Mamaearth, Dream 11, and Muthoot Finance.

items.title: Naver founder returns as chair amid AI focus
items.summary:
- Lee Hae-jin, Naver's founder, is set to return as chair of the board after a seven-year absence.
- His reinstatement is expected to be approved by Naver’s board on February 7, ahead of a March shareholder meeting.
- Naver’s share price jumped 4.8% to a 52-week intraday high of 229,000 won (approximately $158.10) after the news of Lee's potential return.
- Lee aims to strengthen South Korea’s capabilities in 'sovereign AI' and has previously discussed AI collaborations with Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang.

items.title: Temu shifts to US-stored products after tariff exemption ends
items.summary:
- Chinese ecommerce platform Temu is shifting focus to US-stored products due to tariff policy changes.
- The removal of the de minimis tax exemption allows duty-free imports only for goods valued under $800, affecting platforms like Temu and Shein.
- Temu highlights products with a 'local' badge for faster delivery and less reliance on shipments from China.

items.title: South Korea gov’t blocks DeepSeek over data concerns
items.summary:
- South Korea's foreign and trade ministries have blocked access to the Chinese AI service DeepSeek due to user data collection concerns.
- The restriction affects ministry computers connected to external networks, displaying a block message to users.
- This decision underscores ongoing global worries about data privacy and AI technologies.

items.title: Drone battery startup Dreamfly raises $1.4m seed funding
items.summary:
- Bengaluru-based Dreamfly Innovations raised $1.4 million in seed funding.
- Funding round led by Avaana Capital with participation from Sunicon Ventures and other investors.
- Dreamfly, founded in 2022, develops fire-resistant thermal batteries and graphene-based solutions for drones and aviation.
- Clients include Tata Advanced Systems, Larsen & Toubro, General Aeronautics, and Neosky India.
- Funds will expand production, grow workforce, and enhance R&D.
- Efforts align with India's "Atmanirbhar Bharat" initiative to boost domestic drone ecosystem.

items.title: Crypto infrastructure startup Reservoir raises $14m series A
items.summary:
- Reservoir, a crypto infrastructure startup, raised US$14 million in series A funding.
- Investment led by Union Square Ventures with contributions from Coinbase Ventures, Variant, Archetype, and 1kx.
- Funding structured as equity with token warrants, concluded recently after starting in mid-2024.
- Founded in 2021, Reservoir focused on NFT trading infrastructure, working with clients like Coinbase and OpenSea.
- New funding will expand offerings to support token trading across various blockchain networks.

items.title: Alphabet stock falls 8% amid rising AI investments
items.summary:
- Alphabet's stock dropped by over 8% on February 5, the largest decline since October 2023.
- The decline followed fourth-quarter results that missed Wall Street's revenue expectations.
- Despite surpassing earnings expectations, revenue of US$96.47 billion was below the expected US$96.56 billion.
- Year-over-year revenue growth was 12%, but segments like YouTube advertising and search showed slower growth.
- Alphabet plans to invest $75 billion in AI by 2025, with significant infrastructure spending expected in Q1 2025.
- Recent developments include a focus on AI and cloud services amid slowing ad growth, and concerns over US AI leadership.

items.title: Hitachi Ventures raises $400m fund for tech innovation
items.summary:
- Hitachi Ventures has announced the launch of a $400 million fund aimed at fostering technology innovation.
- The fund will focus on investing in startups and tech companies that drive advancement in various sectors.
- This initiative reflects Hitachi's commitment to enhancing its innovation capabilities and expanding its portfolio in the tech industry.

items.title: Grab-GoTo deal buzz returns: why it might be real this time
items.summary:
- Grab and GoTo Group are reportedly reopening merger talks after a year.
- Potential deal could value GoTo at over US$7 billion, considering an all-share purchase.
- Grab's share price has increased by 45% while GoTo's has stagnated, making an all-share deal more attractive for Grab.
- Many GoTo shareholders, especially private equity funds, are expected to seek returns soon due to fund lifecycle pressures.
- There are indications that market sentiment regarding the deal is more positive this time.

items.title: Huawei hits $118b revenue, fastest growth in 4 years
items.summary:
- Huawei’s annual revenue for 2024 reached 860 billion yuan (US$118.27 billion), reflecting a 22% increase from the previous year.
- This revenue marks the company’s fastest growth in four years.
- In 2023, Huawei’s total annual revenue was 704.2 billion yuan (US$96.82 billion).
- The company credited its success to growth across various business segments.
- [Timeline of recent Huawei developments](https://www.techinasia.com/news/huawei-hits-118b-revenue-fastest-growth-4-years) including partnerships and product launches related to AI and HarmonyOS.

items.title: Indonesian recommerce startup secures pre-seed funding
items.author: Mike Roosevelt, Niko Abdulrachman
items.summary:
- Liquid8 is an Indonesian startup that has secured pre-seed funding from SPIL Ventures.
- The funding aims to enhance recommerce solutions that reduce overstock waste while supporting Indonesian MSMEs.
- Founded in 2023, Liquid8 addresses inefficiencies in ecommerce and waste management sectors.
- In 2024, the company processed over 2,700 tons of overstock, redirecting unsold items to the wholesale market for small businesses.

items.title: Saudi VC invests $1b in 800 startups, SMEs
items.summary:
- Saudi Venture Capital Company (SVC) has committed US$1 billion to investments since 2018.
- The total investment, including partners, amounts to US$4.8 billion.
- SVC has supported 54 funds and facilitated investments in over 800 startups and SMEs across various sectors such as ecommerce, fintech, healthcare, edtech, transportation, and logistics.

items.title: SEA’s pet tech firms have investors’ tails wagging
items.summary:
- Luxury brand Louis Vuitton released its first-ever dog accessory line in October 2023, reflecting the rise of pet ownership globally.
- The Asia Pacific pet care market is projected to grow at a CAGR of 4% from 2024 to 2029, outpacing North America and Western Europe.
- Thailand is expected to lead the growth in the region with a CAGR of 8.7% between 2024 and 2029, driven by its mature pet ecosystem and economic growth.

items.title: Ant Group names Alibaba veteran as new CFO
items.summary:
- Ant Group appoints Liu Zheng as the new CFO, effective immediately.
- Liu succeeds Cyril Han, who will take over as CEO on March 1, 2025.
- Prior to this role, Liu Zheng was the CFO of Cainiao, Alibaba's logistics subsidiary.

items.title: Indian fintech firm Cashfree secures $53m led by Krafton
items.summary:
- Cashfree Payments has secured 450 crore rupees (US$53 million) in a funding round led by Krafton and the Apis Growth Fund II.
- The funding will support the company’s expansion of payment solutions and market reach.
- Cashfree processes up to 12,000 transactions per second during peak periods and collaborates with platforms like Shopify, Wix, and WooCommerce.
- The company offers tools such as Embedded Payments and Secure ID to reduce fraud.

items.title: A cheat sheet of M&As in Southeast Asia
items.summary:
- Since 2006, Tech in Asia has tracked M&A activity in Southeast Asia.
- Significant increases in landmark purchases and overall M&A deal counts have been observed recently.
- The article provides insights into deal structures, trends, and sizes excluding undisclosed deal sizes.
- It includes a breakdown of active industries and the leading countries involved in M&A activities in the region.

items.title: US backtracks on decision to suspend China package deliveries
items.summary:
- The US has reversed its decision to suspend package deliveries from China.
- The decision affects international shipping and e-commerce businesses relying on these services.
- The reversal aims to improve trade relationships following recent tensions.

items.title: US suspends ecommerce deliveries from China amid Trump’s tariffs
items.summary:
- The United States Postal Service (USPS) has temporarily suspended all package deliveries from mainland China and Hong Kong.
- This suspension is linked to rising trade tensions due to Trump's tariffs on Chinese imports.
- Consumers using Chinese ecommerce platforms like Temu and Shein will face increased costs, with tariffs ranging from 16% to over 30% on products that were previously exempt.
- The policy change follows China's imposition of retaliatory tariffs on American goods.

items.title: Cake Group’s Bake shuts down in Singapore after buyout
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Bake.io will cease services in Singapore starting May 1, 2025, as announced on February 5.
- The platform was sold by Cake Group to GSTechnologies Ltd. on January 2, 2025.
- Bake previously indicated services would continue uninterrupted, but the license exemption for the platform has been discontinued.

items.title: SG’s Telcoin to become first regulated digital asset bank in US
GM to cut Cruise robotaxi staff by 50%
The force is strong in Solo
items.summary:
- Solo, Indonesia has attracted significant tech investment despite its small size and lower operational costs compared to Jakarta.
- The city's appeal includes proximity to top universities, providing a rich talent pool.
- Gibran Rakabuming Raka, son of former president Joko Widodo, became the mayor in 2021, potentially influencing tech firms' decisions to invest in Solo.
- More tech companies in Indonesia are lessening their reliance on Jakarta due to high living costs in the capital.
- The article also covers SingPost's CEO resignation amid a scandal and highlights investigations into Shein by European authorities.

items.title: Indian gov’t warns employees on using ChatGPT, DeepSeek
items.summary:
- The Indian Finance Ministry has issued an internal advisory warning employees against using AI tools like ChatGPT and DeepSeek for official work due to data security risks.
- The advisory, dated Jan. 29, emphasizes the potential compromise of confidential government documents when using these apps on office devices.
- While the authenticity of the advisory is confirmed by three ministry officials, it remains unclear if the restrictions extend to other government departments.
- This warning comes amid ongoing legal challenges faced by OpenAI in India, stemming from disputes with major media companies regarding its operations and jurisdiction.

items.title: Meet the 50 top-funded startups and tech companies in India
items.summary:
- The article presents a list of 50 startups and tech companies in India with the highest funding amounts raised from investors.
- Funding data is based on information compiled by Tech in Asia and is updated regularly.
- The list only includes funding data from the past two years, emphasizing recent investment trends in the Indian tech ecosystem.
- Readers can explore more through links to a comprehensive database of tech companies in Asia and the research methodology used to compile the list.

items.title: Paris AI summit to highlight Trump, DeepSeek
items.summary:
- The AI Action Summit will occur in Paris on February 10-11, focusing on AI development and collaboration among nearly 100 nations.
- The summit aims to find common ground between the US and China regarding AI advancement.
- Key topics include open-source AI systems, clean energy for data centers, labor impacts, and national sovereignty in the AI market.
- OpenAI CEO Sam Altman will give a keynote address; US Vice President JD Vance will represent the US delegation.

items.title: Coinbase urges US regulators to allow bank crypto services
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Coinbase is advocating for U.S. regulators to enable banks to offer cryptocurrency services.
- The company emphasizes that this change could provide greater access to digital currencies.
- Coinbase argues that regulatory clarity is vital for broader adoption of crypto in mainstream finance.

items.title: AI data foundry firm CEO to discuss China’s AI with US
items.author: Alexandr Wang
items.summary:
- Alexandr Wang, CEO of Scale AI, is meeting with US lawmakers and officials in Washington this week.
- The discussions focus on China’s AI advancements and their impact on US competitiveness.
- Scale AI provides data labeling services to major clients like OpenAI and the US Department of Defense.
- Wang highlights China's rapid progress in AI and its implications during discussions about US technological leadership.

items.title: Nissan ends Honda merger talks amid EV market concerns
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Nissan has officially ended discussions for a merger with Honda.
- The decision comes amid increasing concerns about the electric vehicle (EV) market.
- Factors influencing their decision include market volatility and the need for clearer paths in EV development.

items.title: Indian foodtech firm Mealawe raises $1m
items.author: Rupesh Kumar, Pratap Haldar, Nikhil Jain
items.summary:
- Mealawe, based in Pune, raised US$1 million from international investors, including Shark Tank founders and Goldman Sachs angels.
- The funding will facilitate expansion to 14 cities and a goal of delivering 1 million meals monthly.
- Mealawe, which began operations in October 2022, currently serves Pune, Bangalore, Mumbai, and Kota, delivering over 30,000 meals each month.
- The company creates economic opportunities for women through its structured kitchen model and sources organic ingredients in partnership with farmers.
- It also provides corporate cafeteria solutions via a virtual platform for businesses.

items.title: Alipay transactions surge during Chinese New Year holiday
items.summary:
- Alipay saw a significant rise in transaction volume during the 2025 Chinese New Year holiday, with increases both domestically and internationally.
- Outbound spending using Alipay increased by 30% year-on-year.
- Inbound spending by international travelers in China rose by 150% compared to the previous year.
- Contributing factors included visa-free policies and eased travel restrictions.
- Transactions by foreign e-wallet users in China through Alipay+ rose by 94% during the holiday.

items.title: Programmatic ads firm StackAdapt nets $235m equity funding
items.author: Vitaly Pecherskiy, Yang Han, Ildar Shar
items.summary:
- StackAdapt secured US$235 million in equity funding led by Teachers’ Venture Growth.
- The funding round included Intrepid Growth Partners and other investors, bringing total investment to over US$500 million.
- Founded in 2014, StackAdapt specializes in AI-driven advertising solutions and generates approximately US$500 million in annual revenue with an estimated valuation of US$2.5 billion.

items.title: Resale tech firm Archive raises $30m series B
items.author: Emily Gittins, Ryan Rowe
items.summary:
- Archive, a US-based resale software company, raised US$30 million in a series B round led by Energize Capital.
- Other investors include Lightspeed Venture Partners, G9 Ventures, and Bain Capital Ventures.
- Founded in 2021, Archive assists fashion brands in creating resale platforms with features such as smart pricing and analytics tools.
- The company aims to enhance its software and expand offerings as the US secondhand fashion market is projected to reach US$73 billion by 2028 due to sustainable shopping demand.

items.title: DeepSeek boosts cloud services for Chinese tech firms
items.summary:
- Several Chinese tech firms, including [Baidu AI Cloud](https://www.baidu.com), [Huawei Cloud](https://www.huawei.com), [Alibaba Cloud](https://www.alibabacloud.com), [Tencent Cloud](https://cloud.tencent.com), [360 Digital Security](https://www.360.com), and [ZStack](https://www.zstack.io), have integrated DeepSeek's large language models into their cloud platforms.
- The integration features the DeepSeek-R1 and DeepSeek-V3 models.
- The goal is to enhance capabilities for developers and enterprise users.

items.title: 50 rising startups and tech companies in India
Panasonic restructures to focus on AI, data centers
items.summary:
- Panasonic is restructuring to reduce costs and focus on AI and data centers while streamlining underperforming segments.
- Possible restructuring of the TV business; no confirmed decisions yet.
- CEO Yuki Kusumi exploring alternatives to a sale of certain segments.
- Aims to boost profits by 150 billion yen (approximately US$966 million) by 2027 and another 150 billion yen by 2029 through consolidation efforts.
- Partnered with Anthropic to expand AI revenue and is targeting high-efficiency components for data centers.
- Transitioning focus from consumer electronics to automotive batteries and industrial devices, benefitting from US tax credits.

items.title: Seeds Capital, Tin Men to invest $300m in startups
items.author: null
items.summary:
- Seeds Capital and Tin Men Capital are set to co-invest $300 million in startups over the next three years.
- The collaboration aims to support startups amidst a challenging funding landscape.
- Investments will be made alongside private entities, potentially increasing total investment amounts and including the government’s venture capital firm.

items.title: Huawei, Moore Threads adopt DeepSeek’s AI models
items.summary:
- Chinese tech firms Moore Threads and Huawei are supporting DeepSeek’s open-source AI models.
- Moore Threads will utilize its domestic GPUs for DeepSeek’s V3 and R1 models and plans to deploy its KUAE GPU computing cluster.
- Huawei is integrating DeepSeek’s models into its Ascend cloud service via a partnership with SiliconFlow.
- These initiatives aim to enhance China’s AI capabilities and global competitiveness.

items.title: Infibeam’s Q3 Profit Surges by 50% Year-on-Year
items.summary:
- Infibeam Avenues reported a 50% year-on-year increase in consolidated profit after tax for Q3 FY25, totaling 64.4 crore rupees (US$7.39 million).
- The net profit grew nearly 36% from the previous quarter's 47.4 crore rupees (US$5.44 million).
- Operating revenue rose by 18% year-on-year to 1,070.3 crore rupees (US$122.80 million), with 95% derived from the payment business, CCAvenue, which saw revenue up by 19%.
- EBITDA increased by 40% year-on-year, reaching 101.4 crore rupees (US$11.63 million).
- Infibeam, established in 2007, provides digital payment solutions and serves clients such as Indigo, Jio, and ICICI Bank.
- Upcoming product launches include ReddiffPay and RediffOne, along with plans to expand services into the US and Australia by FY25.

items.title: HR unicorn Deel secures $300m, maintains $12b valuation
items.summary:
- Deel secured US$300 million in secondary investments from General Catalyst and Mubadala, keeping its valuation at US$12 billion.
- The transaction was from existing investors selling shares, not new capital.
- Deel has raised nearly US$680 million in total funding.
- The company reported an annual revenue run rate of US$800 million for 2024, a 70% increase year-over-year, and has been profitable for two years.
- Founded in 2019, Deel operates in 150 countries with a workforce of 5,000 employees.
- The company faces legal challenges, including a Florida lawsuit alleging US$2.7 billion in money laundering and sanctions violations, which it denies.

items.title: Syfe bids $40.7m to acquire Australian platform Selfwealth
items.summary:
- Syfe, a Singapore-based investment platform, has made a non-binding offer to acquire Australian digital investment platform Selfwealth for A$65 million (US$40.7 million).
- The acquisition aims to integrate Selfwealth's platform into Syfe while maintaining its independent brand.
- This move is part of Syfe's 2024 growth strategy through acquisitions.

items.title: Snap Q4 revenue up 14%, users rise to 453m
items.summary:
- Snap Inc. reported Q4 adjusted earnings of 16 cents per share, exceeding expectations of 14 cents.
- Revenue increased by 14% to $1.56 billion, surpassing the estimate of $1.55 billion.
- Daily active users rose by 9% year-over-year to 453 million, exceeding the forecast of 450.8 million.
- Investments in AI and machine learning enhanced Snap's advertising platform, benefiting revenue from small and mid-sized businesses.
